result.execSummary:
All charges against Sylvester Knitter IV in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Sylvester Knitter IV is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sylvester Knitter not in court.  Jeremy Robert Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On motion of the State, Court ordered case dismissed.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Rosemary Reyes-Cuevas for Reyna Ivonne Morales.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  sdg

Defendant has located an organization at which to complete Community Service.  Based upon the defendant's compliance with Deferred Prosecution Agreement, matter is adjourned for review hearing in Branch 33.  Review hearing scheduled for May 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
WCS Report.  Filed, sdg.
(WCS).  Filed, sdg.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Sylvester Knitter in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  

Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement.The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, pled GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum to Plea Questionaire received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgement of Conviction.  The Court reviewed the Intake Requirement and Further Conditions with the defendant.  The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings transferred to Judge Ashley, Branch 33 for review hearing.  Review hearing scheduled for February 15, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the Northern border of W. Bolivar Ave, the Southern border of W. Edgerton Ave, the Western border of S. 28th Street and the Eastern border of 26th Street.  Court further orders no use or possession of illegal or controlled substances without a valid prescription or drug paraphernalia.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Sylvester Knitter in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing. Court GRANTS state's motion State's motion to impose a geographical no contact order.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to the Reserve Judge presiding in Branch 21 in room 622 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Reyes-Cuevas on behalf of attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales in court, defendant Sylvester Knitter not in court, in custody.  Ann R. Lopez appeared for the State of Wisconsin. CMC. Defense requests an adjournment. Court will calendar matter for Motion Hearing so defendant is produced. Court grants defense request. Case adjourned to branch 24.  Motion hearing scheduled for December 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to be monitored by Drug Testing
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription

Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.  Defendant to have no contact with: Target, 4777 S 27th Street.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Adam c Essling.  Defendant Sylvester Knitter in custody.  
Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: sm  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.
Scheduling conference scheduled for December 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.    Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant; Original in file. ($250.00 signature bond) gj
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 250.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter not in court.  Joy Hammond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk ssm.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a bench warrant to be issued.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.
from JusticePoint:  Discharge Summary.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin. JusticePoint report reviewed. Defendant clarified that he is not homeless, as reported by JusticePoint. Case adjourned in branch 24.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with TARGET, 4777 S. 27th Street.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.
DEFENDANT to be monitored by drug testing.
No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter in court with attorney Reyna Ivonne Morales.  Defendant Sylvester Knitter in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin. sdg
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Sylvester Knitter not in court.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.  Court ordered any bail posted to be forfeited.  State's motion for Judgment of Bond Forfeiture 30 days after notification from the Clerk of Circuit Court's Office is granted by the Court.  Court makes finding that there is a possible victim identified, therefore, Court stays order of forfeiture with recompense to be determined at close of case.vb
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 8/27/15 @ 1:30 pm
